decks.notes: The deck aims to quickly assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo by using cards like Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Dread Return to mill the library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Nadu, Winged Wisdom. It includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Daze, and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Meticulous Archive provide card advantage and digging for key pieces. Urza's Saga and Prismatic Ending offer additional utility and interaction. The deck is optimized for a fast and streamlined win through combo interactions.

The main concept of this deck revolves around assembling the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It uses cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage to quickly find and copy Dark Depths. The deck also includes cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Green Sun's Zenith to help find key pieces and protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Swords to Plowshares and Endurance provide disruption and protection against opposing threats. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful threat.

This Grixis Control deck emphasizes a combination of card advantage, disruption, removal, and versatile threats to control the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also generating card advantage through cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage. The removal spells like Fatal Push and Tyrant's Scorn help deal with threats on the board, while the versatile threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Thundertrap Trainer can apply pressure and close out the game. The deck also includes a selection of lands to provide the necessary mana base for the powerful spells.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a game-ending play. It utilizes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and control the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty to apply pressure and close out the game. It aims to win through a fast and efficient reanimation strategy while controlling the game with counterspells and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts and utilizing them to generate card advantage and disrupt opponents. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Thoughtcast, and Urza's Bauble, the deck can draw cards efficiently. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can be used to recur artifacts from the graveyard, while cards like Force of Will and Metallic Rebuke provide disruption. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to find key artifacts and generate additional value. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast plays and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's hand and spells, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game. Cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide additional aggression, while Nethergoyf can quickly grow in power. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and utility lands to support the deck's aggressive and disruptive game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating value through the synergy of cards like Urza's Saga, Exploration, Life from the Loam, and Crop Rotation. It aims to lock down the opponent with cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Boseiju, Who Endures, while setting up a quick win condition with the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes a mix of utility lands and disruptive spells to handle different threats and create advantageous board states.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive tactics with powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, backed up by a suite of efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to control the game. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation through cards like Preordain and Brainstorm to maintain a fast pace and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Stifle and Wasteland further adds to the aggro strategy by hindering the opponent's plans. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a proactive game plan while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The primary focus of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources while maintaining a consistent aggressive presence on the battlefield. With a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and disruptive creatures, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and take advantage of tempo swings. By utilizing cards like Swords to Plowshares, Aether Vial, and Recruiter of the Guard, the deck can generate incremental advantage and outvalue the opponent. The addition of Yorion as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in longer games.

This deck focuses on using the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom along with Nomads en-Kor to create a powerful engine for card draw and manipulation. The deck also includes various support cards like Force of Will, Green Sun's Zenith, and Natural Order to help protect the combo and find key pieces. Key cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Keen-Eyed Curator provide additional value and options for the player. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional synergy and flexibility in gameplay.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly cast big, powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Apex Devastator with the help of cards like Call Forth the Tempest and Creative Technique. Using cards like Throes of Chaos and Tibalt's Trickery, the deck aims to manipulate the top few cards of the library to ensure that these creatures can be cast for free or at a reduced cost. The deck also includes ways to generate additional mana and explosive combos to overwhelm the opponent in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful board state by utilizing artifacts to ramp up mana and take advantage of abilities that allow for card advantage and extra activations. The goal is to generate enough mana to cast powerful spells like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, while also controlling the board with cards like Portable Hole and Pithing Needle. The synergy between cards like Mystic Forge, Grim Monolith, and Voltaic Key allow for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly filling your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Brazen Borrower for additional disruption and card selection. With a mix of fast mana and powerful threats, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can react.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Nihil Spellbomb, while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Force of Will. You want to establish tempo with cards like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower, while also using creatures like Nethergoyf and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to pressure your opponent. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps filter through your deck. The deck also includes utility lands like Undercity Sewers for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive.

Utilizing a combination of disruption and efficient threats, this Dimir Tempo deck aims to control the game tempo and disrupt opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with early threats. The deck leans heavily on counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and leverage cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck features cards like Bitter Triumph and Murktide Regent to close out games quickly, while utilizing efficient removal like Fatal Push to keep the opponent's board in check.

This Bant Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and controlling the board. It utilizes a combination of counterspells like Force of Will, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. It also has powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to close out the game. The deck is designed to outlast the opponent through attrition and card advantage, ultimately leading to victory through overwhelming control of the game.
